Thanks.
The "without action" is really helpful; it returns the status of the job, as
you remembered.

curl -v  -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location -H "Accept: application/xml"
https://localhost:8443/engine/job/myjob

and from the output I managed to take the necessary info.

Thanks again

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Gordon Mohr
Sent: Monday, April 7, 2014 10:24 PM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] automatic tear down through command line
launch

On 4/4/14, 1:27 AM, Ferencz Marton wrote:
>
>
> Hello,
>
> Does anybody know a way to automatically tear down a job when it's
finished?

See:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.x+API+Guide#Her
itrix3.xAPIGuide-TerminateJob

> Is there  a way to find out if a job is finished through command line?

Try a GET on the same job URI, but without one of the actions. If I recall
correctly, that will return status info equivalent to the web page, in JSON
or XML as desired based on your 'Accept' header.

(The docs seem to have just overlooked explicitly mentioning this
action-free status-check.)

- Gordon
